nox:section.p: Nox is a free XML Content Management System (CMS) for creating static web sites (offline generation). It has limited functionality, but is quite flexible for those who have XSLT+CSS knowledge.
The framework is based on libxml2. Pages are written in XML and transformed to XHTML 1.0 via XSLT stylesheets.
Nox was started in 2002 as xproc but in 2005 the W3C announced the launch of the XML Processing Model Working Group, which unfortunately was also called XProc.

ul.li: Based on open standards such as XML, XSLT and CSS
Content (XML) is separated from presentation (XSLT, CSS)
Editing well-formed XML is not straigthforward (you need a good editor)
XML / XSLT knowledge is required to modify structural page layout
There are a few constraints to embed scripting (PHP, JavaScript) into XML
The process is batch based, it does not manage concurrency, user rights and versioning.
Link validity is not checked at compile time
Modifying the main menu requires layout fix (preferred.css: #topnav a.nav)
XIncludes are not dependency checked (requires -f to force rebuild).
You can only specify one extra file for dependency check (usually menu.xi)
No locking mechanism for editing pages in Cocoon (it's a single user CMS)
PHP search engine and link checker (XTS)
